projects.label: Lexi AI | Language Learning Web App

desc.text: Lexi AI is a web application powered by Gemini to help you learn languages.
Upskillz is an online course marketplace where users can enroll in courses and access lessons. They can also become instructors and write their own courses.

projects.text: I unlocked the knowledge to implement infinite scrolling in Vue.

projects.label: Code Bloc | Open-Source repository search hub

desc.text: Code bloc is a place to give visibility to open-source projects by making them easily searchable.
Ticksy is an application to help manage productivity for projects. It keeps track of your progress on each task you set for yourself.
I was able to learn and implement the MVVM pattern (Model View View Model). I was also able to dive deeper into data binding in WPF, to update views with information from our View Models.

This is an Etsy clone React and Node.js based project. I was able to further improve my unit testing skills using Jest and SuperTest and as a team, we reached 80% overall coverage. Some features included account creation, SPA item browsing, vendor-seller dynamic, payment using Stripe.
As the team leader, it was important to keep the team focused as we learned many new technologies in the process.

projects.text: I gained a lot of unit testing knowledge using Jest and SuperTest.

desc.text: This is a Reddit clone Java-based application to replicate the core functionalities of the website. I learned a great deal about JWT, as well as using MapStruct to build proper DTOs in combination with Jakarta for form validations. Some features included account creation, communities, posting, nested comments and voting.
As the team leader, I helped guide our priorities, manage expectations as well as keeping our team organized to meet our deadlines.

A simple To-do list using PHP with a clean interface. This project helped me better understand sessions and safeguard privacy by only displaying information pertaining to the currently logged user. Using MVC, it provided a structured approach to managing the application state and interactions.

projects.text: Implementing JWT in Java was a big task but I gained a lot of experience doing it.

desc.text: FourCasters is a Java-based project to focus on implementing a RESTful API to provide information to the Front-end as well as gather information through external API for the weather, events, tarot reading, fortune telling and historical facts.

projects.text: I made a tarot card flip animation. It was great to practice CSS3 animations.
Shaders are like magic or something! Accessing individual pixels is pretty cool.

desc.text: Ninja Cat is a simple, yet engaging game made with JavaScript. I really got to experience what it could do, using HTML5 Canvas. I learned to write a proper state machine as well as manipulate graphics by creating animations and writing shaders.

projects.text: SEO can be useful to provide the correct details about a page. There is a huge amount of possible fields.

desc.text: With this fictional brewery website, I learned the steps to design websites. Starting with wireframing, and creating the mockup using Figma and finally realizing the website, which is responsive using Bootstrap 5.

This MySQL project served as a learning point to explore additional database functionalities such as using Procedures, Functions and Views. The purpose was creating a system without a user interface to focus solely on database management with features such as keeping track of books, users and manage late fees.

projects.text: I'm really enjoying learning MySQL, which has so many functionalities with Functions, Views and Procedures.
